curriculum: Attività espletata in tale funzione:  Sviluppo e mantenimento certificazione dei Sistemi di Gestione per la Qualità ISO 9001:2008 nell’area sanitaria e di staff (certificato n. 5871)  Consulenza e coordinamento nei confronti dei sistemi qualità sviluppatisi autonomamente: Dipartimento ad Attività Integrata di Pediatria (certificato n. 5074), Laboratorio di Oncoematologia Pediatrica (certificato n. 9231) e Banca di Sangue di Cordone (certificato n. 14500), area Oncologica negli anni 2004-2006 (Senologia, Oncologia Medica, Radioterapia) armonizzando i sistemi specifici con quello aziendale,  Auditing presso tutte le UU.OO. rientranti nel Sistema di Gestione per la Qualità Aziendale  Supporto metodologico per la stesura dei documenti aziendali  Gestione del database aziendale della documentazione sanitaria  Autorizzazione all’esercizio LR 22/2002: Pianificazione e gestione di tutti gli adempimenti inerenti le procedure di Autorizzazione all’esercizio  Accreditamento Istituzionale LR 22/2002. Pianificazione e gestione di tutti gli adempimenti inerenti le procedure Accreditamento Istituzionale  Accreditamento di Eccellenza LR 22/2002. Progetto Programma per la validazione degli standard e processo per il Programma di Accreditamento di Eccellenza della Regione del Veneto in collaborazione con Accreditation Canada  Centri Regionali Specializzati: coordinamento e gestione di tutti gli adempimenti necessari alla conferma dei centri presenti in Azienda Ospedaliera di Padova (n. 24) sia per le richieste di nuove attivazioni (n.28).  Corsi di formazione: pianificazione e realizzazione dei corsi di formazione in collaborazione con la Struttura Semplice Interaziendale Formazione e Progetti Internazionali sui temi della Qualità e del Governo Clinico  Stesura dell’atto aziendale dell’Azienda Ospedaliera di Padova secondo le Linee guida regionale previste dalla DGR 975/2013 e s.m.i. e predisposizione dei provvedimenti connessi alla sua implementazione Progetti di miglioramento  Servizio di Logistica aziendale con analisi di processo secondo lo standard ISO 9001:2000 e i cui risultati sono stati utilizzati nell’ambito dei “cantieri” attivati in collaborazione con l’Agenzia Regionale Socio Sanitaria nell’ottica di integrazioni in area vasta dei processi tecnico-amministrativi di supporto  Sistema di monitoraggio dei Servizi Alberghieri appaltati con progettazione e implementazione di un sistema di rilevazione della customer satisfaction e reporting informatizzato  Coordinamento progetto di “lean organization” della Piastra Operatoria dell’Ortopedia, della UOC Medicina di Laboratorio, della UOC Clinica di Oncoematologia Pediatrica – Day Hospital  Creazione, in collaborazione con la UOC Programmazione e Controllo di Gestione, di una area specifica degli obiettivi di budget aziendali inerente i sistemi di gestione per la qualità e area Legge Regionale 22/2002  Mappatura e reingegnerizzazione degli organigrammi e dei processi dei Dipartimenti ad Attività Integrata Sperimentale dell’Azienda Ospedaliera di Padova in ottica di area omogenea per intensità di cure  Mappatura e reingegnerizzazione degli organigrammi e dei processi dei servizi di staff alla Direzione Generale e dei Dipartimenti Interaziendali di area amministrativa  definizione della nuova articolazione organizzativa della Direzione Sanitaria (delibera n. 1127/2012) sia in termini di strutture afferenti che in termini di responsabilità di processi;  contributo metodologico e organizzativo alla stesura dei Percorsi Assistenziali:  partecipazione all’attività reingegnerizzazione del processo di Week Surgery a seguito dell’attivazione, avvenuta nel 2011, del Centro di Chirurgia a ricovero breve;  mappatura dei processi amministrativi dell’Azienda Ospedaliera di Padova e loro reingnerizzazione in coerenza con l’Atto Aziendale.  Realizzazione di un’attività sinergica con Direzione Medica Ospedaliera, Servizio Rischio Clinico e Sicurezza Paziente e Servizio per le Professioni Sanitarie, in un’ottica di gestione proattiva al rischio attraverso stesura, validazione e diffusione di procedure aziendali specifiche e l’implementazione di corsi di formazione aziendale sui temi:  Documentazione sanitaria aziendale  Centralità della persona ammalata: comunicazione, informazione e consenso, indirizzi futuri  Diagnosi precoce e primi trattamenti della sepsi  Le banche dati di Micromedex: uno strumento per trasferire le evidenze scientifiche per l’efficacia e la sicurezza dei farmaci nella pratica clinica.  Consulenza e supporto metodologico ai sistemi di Accreditamento di Eccellenza Professionale (Malattie infettive e tropicali, Angiologia, Bariatric Center, CPA-UK per il Servizio di Medicina di Laboratorio, Baby Heart)  Progetto di Accreditamento secondo lo Standard JACIE presso il Centro Trapianti di midollo Osseo dell’Oncoematologia Pediatrica

name: Giuseppe
curriculum: Giuseppe Lippi has a degree in Medicine and specialization in Clinical Biochemistry and Laboratory Medicine. He serves as Full Professor of Clinical Biochemistry and Molecular Biology at the University of Verona (Italy), Director Laboratory Service of the University Hospital of Verona (Italy) and Dean of the Faculty of Medicine at University of Verona. He has published 2140 articles in peer-reviewed journals, his total Impact Factor is over 13000 and the H-index is 130. Has participated to over 600 national and international congresses and has given more over 350 lectures to national and international meetings. He chairs the IFCC Task Force on COVID-19 and the EFLM Task Force Preparation of Labs for Emergencies. He has been awarded with the 2014 AACC Management Sciences and Patient Safety Division Award for outstanding contributions in the field of patient safety, the 2015 AACC Outstanding Speaker Award and the 2023 EFLM Award for Scientific Achievements in Laboratory Medicine. He has also received research grants from the EC and from Italian Heath Care Agencies. Giuseppe Lippi is Editor in Chief of “Annals of Translational Medicine” and “Journal of Laboratory and Precision Medicine” and also serves as Associate Editor of the journals “Clinical Chemistry and Laboratory Medicine”, “Seminars in Thrombosis and Hemostasis” and “Diagnosis”, is member of the European Federation of Laboratory Medicine (EFLM) Working Group on Preanalytical Variability (WG-PRE). The main fields of research include COVID-19, analytical and clinical validation of phenotypic and molecular biomarkers, diagnostics of thrombotic and hemorrhagic disorders and relevant assay methods, pre-analytical variability.

name: Francesco
curriculum: APPOINTMENTS Past: - Visiting Fellow, Laboratory of Genetics, NCI, NIH, Bethesda, MD, USA; - Guest Researcher, Gene Expression Program, EMBL, Heidelberg; - Assistant Professor of General Pathology, University of Udine Medical School; - Associate Professor of Molecular Pathology, University of Udine Medical School; - Component of the Teaching Board of the Socrates/Erasmus supported International Annual Course in “Bioethics and the New Perspectives in Biomedicine”; - Full Professor of Molecular Pathology, University of Udine Medical School, Udine, Italy; - Vice Director, Laboratory of Radioimmunology, University Hospital, University of Udine Medical School; - Director Cellular and Molecular Diagnosis and Therapy Unit, Laboratory of Radioimmunologia, University Hospital, University of Udine Medical School; - Director, Laboratory of Radioimmunology, University Hospital, University of Udine Medical School. - Coordinator of Medical Education, University of Udine Medical Center, Udine, Italy. - Coordinator Corso Integrato di “Patologia Cellulare e Oncologia” at University of Udine Medical School; - Founder Centro di Eccellenza per lo studio del muscolo in condizioni di Microgravity, Aging, Training and Immobility (M.A.T.I.); - Coordinator “Servizio di Colture cellulari” del Centro di Eccellenza per lo studio del muscolo in condizioni di Microgravity, Aging, Training and Immobility (M.A.T.I.); - Vice Director University of Udine Center for Regenerative Medicine (C.I.M.E.); - Quality Control / Quality Assurance C.I.M.E.; - Coordinator of the Italian Space Agency Project “From Molecules to Man” (57 research groups, 10 industries and a total 31.000.000 Euro grant). Current: - Full Professor of Clinical Pathology, University of Udine Medical School, Udine, Italy; - Director, Specialty School in “Patologia Clinica e Biochimica Clinica” (Medical Internship program); - Director, Institute of Clinical Pathology, University of Udine Medical Center, Udine, Italy; - Chairman, Department of Laboratory Medicine, University of Udine Medical Center, Udine, Italy; - Rector-Delegate for Interdisciplinary Programs at the University of Udine, Udine, Italy

name: Paolo
curriculum: WORK EXPERIENCE • Dates (from – to) FROM 2016 TO TODAY • Name and address of employer Azienda ULSS 3 Serenissima, Venice Director • Occupation or position held Laboratory Medicine Department From 2004 to 2016 Director Laboratory Medicine Department St. Antony Hospital, Padova EDUCATION AND TRAINING • Dates (from – to) 1980 degree in medicine and surgery Università di Padova 1983 Postgraduate in Clinical and Laboratory Hematology Università di Padova 1989 Postgraduate in Clinical Biology Università di Padova PERSONAL SKILLS AND COMPETENCES MOTHER TONGUE ITALIAN OTHER LANGUAGES Page 2 - Curriculum vitae of [ SURNAME, other names ] For more information go to www.cedefop.eu.int/transparency/ europa.eu.int/comm/education/index_en.html eurescv-search.com/ ENGLISH • Reading skills GOOD • Writing skills GOOD • Verbal skills BASIC ORGANISATIONAL SKILLS AND COMPETENCES I COORDINATE AN ORGANISATION OF 150 PEOPLES IN 5 HOSPITALS SPECIFIC EXPERIENCES IN DIAGNOSIS IN COAGULATION, HEMATOLOGY, CANCER, STAT TESTS, POCT Speaker at over 120 national and international congresses H-index 29 PUBLICATIONS. AUTHOR OF OVER 100 PAPERS WITH A TOTAL IMPACT FACTOR OF 305 AUTHOR OF SEVERAL BOOKS IN DIAGNOSTIC MEDICINE AUTHOR OF A EUROPEAN GUIDELINE ON THROMBOPHILIA LABORATORY DIAGNOSIS COAUTHOR OF 4 NATIONAL LABORATORY GUIDELINES TEACHING FROM 2001 TO TODAY I TAUGHT AT POSTGRADUATE SCHOOL ON CLINICAL PATHOLOGY AT THE PADOVA UNIVERSITY OD STUDIES

name: Tommaso
curriculum: Education He was graduated in Medicine and Surgery with full marks at Modena University and he is specialised in Gastroenterology and Endoscopy, Biochemistry and Clinical Chemistry and Toxicology at Modena University always with full marks (70/70 cum laude). Major Professional and Research Interests He conducted studies on the mechanisms of cellular damage induced by toxic substances, in particular ethanol, cocaine and iron, evaluating the biochemical lesion markers due to the action of free radicals. He has conducted studies on the mechanisms involved in the modulation and expression of the HIV virus. He has developed and validated the introduction of immunochemical methods on automatic instrumentation for drug dosing and has actively participated in the development of both intralaboratory and inter-laboratory quality control programs on immunometric and chromatographic analytical data, in particular toxicological drug. He has developed analytical methods for the determination of substances of abuse, drugs and metabolites of xenobiotics on both high pressure liquid chromatographic systems and in mass spectrometry. Further he is interested in the field of Laboratory Medicine of Autoimmunity and Allergology, EBLM, Oncohematology, Big data analysis, and recently in Covid19 disease. He participated as speaker in several National and International Congresses and Courses. He published 226 papers in peer reviewed Journals reported in PubMed the great majority in International Journals with Impact Factor and more than 100 paper in Italian journal in Italian languages. H Index Scopus and Web of science = 34; Google Scholar 39 He presented more than 400 abstracts of posters or oral communications at National and International Congresses. He conducted several clinical trials according to the GCP rules. Principal Clinical and Hospital Service Responsibilities since 1981 to 1989 he worked in clinical setting as medicine doctor in a general medicine division and Emergency service in Modena Public Health Service and from1990 to 2000 in a Clinical Pharmacology and Toxicology Service. From 2001 he is the Director of Laboratory Medicine Service of the Health Care System in Modena and from 2004 up to now of the Laboratory Medicine and Pathology Department of both Modena Health Public Service and University of Modena. Teaching appointments He taught Toxicology and Clinical Biochemistry in post graduated courses at Modena University and Pavia University as Toxicology, Pathology, Gastroenterology and Microbiology post graduated university medical specializations. ________________________________________________________________ Tommaso Trenti _______________________________________________________________________ 2/2 Responsibilities in the Italian Society of Clinical Biochemistry and Clinical Molecular BiologyLaboratory Medicine (Sibioc-Laboratory Medicine) In the Scientific Societies Sibioc-Laboratory Medicine he was the coordinator and founder of the Study Group on Evidence Based Laboratory Medicine, the Study Group on Autoimmunity and Allergology, and the Big Data and Artificial Intelligence Study Group, now he is the coordinator of the Clinical Immunology Study Group. He has been associate member of the Committee on Evidence Based Laboratory Medicine of the International Federation of Clinical Chemistry (C-EBLM IFCC) and a member of the IOF-IFCC Joint Working Group on Bone Marker Standards since 2009 as well as of the IFCC Study Committee on Autoimmunity . From 2012 to 2017 he was the scientific head of the educational events Sibioc- Laboratory Medicine as Provider. From 2018 to 2020 he was the Chairman of the Scientific Division of SIBioC– Medicina di Laboratorio. He collaborated in the definition of the SIBioC guidelines on Cardiac Biomarkers, Internal QC and on External Quality Assessment, Evidence Based Laboratory methodology, Autoimmunity. He is in the editorial board and he is national editor of LabTestsonLine italian edition, a free access site devoted for citizens or professionals who wish to have information on diagnostic tests. He is in the international advisory board of “Biochimica Clinica” official Journal of SIBioC-Medicina di Laboratorio He acts as referee for the following Journals: Clinical Chemistry, Clinical Chemistry and Laboratory Medicine, Clinica Chimica Acta, Biochimica Clinica, Clinical Biochemistry. From January 2020 he was elected SIBioC Vice President and from January 2022 up to now he is President of SIBioC – Medicina di Laboratorio. Healthcare Management experience He is member of the working group at the AssR National and Regional Health Services Agency on "Technology Assessment” recommendations for clinical laboratory diagnostics and he has been appointed as expert at the Ministry of Health for the revision of the National LEA (Livelli essenziali di Assitenza the basic health care activities that have to be guarantee to all Italian citizen). He collaborated to develop Clinical Governance policy in terms of appropriateness in clinical laboratory in healthcare national board. He has been as teacher in educational courses oriented towards organizational management in healthcare setting at the Ausl of Modena, the Guido Carli Luiss Business School of Rome, University of Milan etc.

name: Guido
curriculum: Dr. Guido Freckmann, MD, is Medical Director and General Manager of the “Institut für Diabetes-Technologie Forschungs- und Entwicklungsgesellschaft mbH an der Universität Ulm” (IfDT), Ulm, Germany. The IfDT is an independent research organization specialized to diabetes technology. The IfDT is accredited and internationally renowned as testing laboratory for BGMS following ISO 15197. Dr. Freckmann is diabetologist of the German Diabetes Association. As a study physician at the IfDT, he was principle investigator for different studies, about e.g. CGM systems, development of closed loop systems or insulin pumps, and cooperates with several industrial and non-industrial partners. Dr. Freckmann received the “Leadership Award” of the Diabetes Technology Society in 2020. In addition, he is chair of the IFCC Working Group on Continuous Glucose Monitoring (WG-CGM), member of the managing board of the diabetes technology working group (AGDT), the commission for laboratory diagnostics (KLD) and the Point-of-Care-Testing (POCT) working group of the German Diabetes Association.

name: Jim F
curriculum: Profile A molecular biologist specialising in the application of molecular analytical methods to routine applied biomeasurement. Heads a team at one of the world’s leading national metrology institutions supporting the development of applied nucleic acid analysis in areas such as metagenomics, precision medicine and infectious disease diagnostics. Advises governments and international organisations on measurement accuracy and standardisation for routine application of molecular methodologies to clinical diagnostics; including PCR and massively paralleled sequencing. Work History 2009-present: multiple roles, currently Science Fellow, NML 2021-present: Visiting Professor, Department of Microbial Sciences, University of Surrey. 2016-2021: Senior Lecturer (0.2 FTE), Department of Microbial Sciences, University of Surrey. 2002-2009: Senior Research Fellow, Centre for Infectious Diseases and International Health, UCL. 2001-2002: Post-Doctoral Research, Connective Tissues Biology Laboratories, Cardiff University. Education PhD. “Mechanically Regulated Genes in Bone.” School of Biosciences. Cardiff University. Awarded 2001 BSc. (Hons) Genetics. The University of Liverpool. Awarded 1997 Scientific Excellence • Led multiple projects (, including large multi-centred international consortia (Appendix A). • Author of over 100 peer reviewed manuscripts including in the leading journals Nature Methods, Clinical Chemistry, The Lancet, Genome Medicine and Nucleic Acid Research (Appendix B). Current H-index of 51. • Expertise in the application and standardisation of advanced molecular methodology to diagnostics (including the drafting and application of regulatory guidelines). • Work with broad international network in academia, government, industry, health care providers and NGOs. Committee/Society/Group Memberships • Chair, Nucleic Acid Analysis Working Group under the BIPM’s Consultative Committee for Amount of Substance, • Committee member: o MHRA Pathogen Advisory Diagnostic Group (PDAG), formally COVID VOC assurance group. o Expert consultant, Molecular Diagnostic Committee of the International Federation of Clinical Chemists, o Standardisation of Genome Amplification Techniques and Serology (SoGATS) group. o ISO TC212 (Clinical laboratory testing and in vitro diagnostic test systems) WG3 (In vitro diagnostic products), WG4 (Microbiology and Molecular Diagnostics) and JWG6 Quality practice for detection of SARS-CoV-2. o British Standards Institute ISO mirror group CH/212, • Member, European Society of Clinical Microbiology and Infectious Diseases (ESCMID) study group on genomic and molecular diagnostics (ESGMD), • Fellow, The Royal College of Physicians (Edin) & The Royal Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene. • Member of scientific advisory board for LGC, inBiome, Qiagen (digital PCR group).

name: Julie
curriculum: Julie Shaw is the Division Head for Biochemistry and Director of Point of Care Testing (POCT) at The Ottawa Hospital. She is also the Regional Discipline Lead for Biochemistry and POCT for the Eastern Ontario Regional Laboratories Association. Julie is chair of the POCT Special Interest group of the Canadian Society of Clinical Chemists (CSCC) and has served two terms as the CSCC representative on the IFCC POCT working group. Julie is also a member of the ADLM critical and POCT executive committee. Julie will serve as chair of the 2024 ADLM International POCT Symposium, which will be held in San Diego, California. Julie’s research interests are focused on quality assurance practices for POCT.

name: Annette
curriculum: Annette Thomas is a Consultant Clinical Biochemist at Cardiff and Vale University Health Board with over 40 years’ experience in Laboratory Medicine, over 20 years of which has been as Director of Weqas, a well-respected International EQA provider and Reference Measurement Laboratory. Annette is also the National Point of Care (POCT) Clinical lead for Wales, a seconded position to the Wales NHS Executive responsible for delivering the strategy plan for POCT. She represents POCT on Welsh Government advisory Committees and chairs the National POCT Strategic Board and the POCT Delivery Group. She is a member of the International Federation of Clinical Chemistry and Laboratory Medicine (IFCC) Task Force on Global Lab Quality and past chair of the IFCC Committee on Analytical Quality. She has previously held posts on the Executive Board of the European Committee for External Quality Assurance Programmes in Laboratory Medicine (EQALM), chair of the All Wales Clinical Biochemistry Audit Group and chair of the National Clinical Biochemistry and Laboratory Medicine (ACB) Audit Committee in the UK. In 2019 she received the EQALM Adam Uldall Award for her contribution to promoting quality in laboratory medicine and the Healthcare Science Lifetime Achievement award from the Welsh Government.

name: Wayne
curriculum: Recognised as a Fellow by two peak bodies, during my +35 years career in laboratory medicine I have contributed extensively to professional bodies, governmental committees, scientific literature and the development of science and scientists in Australia and internationally. Never far from the commercial aspect of pathology and underpinned by Doctor of Philosophy, an MBA and practical experience, my focus has always been on improved productivity, process and growth. My approach to change is open, collaborative, structured and strategic. My passion, however, is working with ministries of health, non-government organisations and regulatory and peak bodies advocating for improved quality testing for infectious diseases. KEY SKILLS • Clinical experience (medical and veterinary) with specialised experience in serological diagnosis of infections and autoimmune diseases • Business management, including responsibility +$4 million budget in private pathology • Laboratory capacity-building • Quality assurance programs • Project management • Information systems including laboratory automation • Stakeholder and people management • Chairing and contributing to committees and regulatory bodies (local and international) • Business development including contract negotiation • Marketing and event management • Widely published scientist, with more than 40 peer-reviewed papers and book chapters

name: Dennis
curriculum: CAREER SUMMARY: Dr Thomas is a Postdoctoral Research Fellow at the Hunter Medical Research Institute (HMRI), University of Newcastle (UoN). He is a mid-career researcher and an experienced clinical trialist with over 14 years of experience in designing and managing clinical trials. He completed his Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Pharmacy from Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences, India. He worked in the pharmaceutical industry for almost five years as a Clinical Research Manager and acquired extensive skills and experience in clinical research (involved in 8 industry RCTs) in designing, conducting, evaluating, and communicating clinical trials. Then, he enrolled and completed a PhD program on ‘System change interventions for smoking cessation in hospitalised patients’ at Monash University, Australia, which comprised a Cochrane review, a large multi-centre RCT and development and psychometric validation of Challenges to Stopping Smoking (CSS-21) scale. Additionally, he also completed a Health Economic Analysis module from Monash University and a Professional Diploma in Clinical Research from Catalyst Clinical Service Pvt Ltd, India. He also obtained a Certified Clinical Research Associate credential (in 2010) from the Association of Clinical Research Professionals, USA. After submitting PhD, he joined as a Clinical Trial Coordinator on an NHMRC-funded smoking cessation RCT (n=1,452) comparing cytisine vs varenicline at the National Drug and Alcohol Research Centre, the University of New South Wales. After completing the RCT, he joined UoN. CONTRIBUTION TO THE FIELD OF REASERCH: Dr Thomas has published >40 peer-reviewed articles and some in high-impact journals including, the Lancet, JAMA, ERJ, Chest, Cochrane Database Syst Rev and Addition. He has completed 5 Australian-based RCTs from inception to completion. He is currently involved in 3 other RCTs. Dr Thomas led the study design and implementation of Australia’s largest phase 3 smoking cessation tele-trial. Dr Thomas also contributed to multiple Cochrane reviews in the area of tobacco smoking and COPD. His recent work includes exploring remission as a new therapeutic goal for the treatment of asthma and developing and evaluating digital asthma care interventions. He is currently leading a large tele-trial aimed at developing and evaluating a comprehensive national digital asthma care program in collaboration with Asthma Australia. Dr Thomas also worked and published in the area of oral corticosteroid and antibiotic stewardship in severe asthma. Dr Thomas attracted $7.5 million NHMRC research funding as a chief investigator and $2 million as an associate investigator. He also attracted more than $2 million in other research grants. RESEARCH TRANSLATION & PROFESSIONAL INVOLVEMENT: Recently, asthma remission, digital asthma care and oral corticosteroid stewardship have gained much attention among the research community, and Dr Thomas’s work enlightened these important therapeutical concepts. Dr Thomas was instrumental in conceptualising and advancing the remission concept in severe asthma, and led the pioneering review in this area, which provided insights into how remission can be achieved in the current scenario. He also published the possibility of achieving remission using mepolizumab, omalizumab and azithromycin. His cytisine RCT showed the potential of cytisine in smoking cessation therapy, and now the drug is under consideration by the TGA and the US FDA. Dr Thomas is a member of the Thoracic Society of Australia and New Zealand, European Respiratory Society, Australian CT Alliance, Society for Research on Nicotine & Tobacco, Cochrane Tobacco Addition Group, Cochrane Airways Group and Indian Pharmaceutical Association. He also contributes to the TGA guideline development panel. SUPERVISION/MENTORING: Dr Thomas has supervised many research staff during his previous appointments, and is currently supervising three research staff, two respiratory physicians, a statistician, a post-doctoral research fellow and a PhD scholar.

name: Peter
curriculum: MBBS, DMed, FRACP, FAAHMS, FThorSoc, FAPSR, FERS A past president of TSANZ (from 2015-16), Professor Peter Gibson is a respiratory physician and clinical scientist studying the disease mechanisms and treatment of severe asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), cough and other airway disorders. A concept leader with >680 published journal articles, Peter has developed innovative approaches around inflammatory subtypes of asthma and cough, airway biomarkers, neurogenic mechanisms, treatments for refractory cough and multidimensional assessment and management of complex airway disorders. He has participated in numerous national and international respiratory guideline panels, and currently co-leads the new Centre of Research Excellence in Asthma Treatment Traits, based in Newcastle. Peter has held concurrent NHMRC practitioner fellowships since 2004 and has received numerous prestigious honours for his contribution to respiratory medicine research including the 2018 ERS Gold medal in Asthma.

name: Marcello
curriculum: Education: 1994-2000: Medical Doctor degree “cum laude” at the University of Padova Medical School; 2000-2005: Residency in Internal Medicine at the Clinica Medica IV (Padova University Hospital) and Medicina Interna I (Treviso University Hospital), University of Padova Medical School; 2006-2009: Ph.D. degree in Cardiovascular Science, University of Padova Medical School. Professional experiences and current position: 2003-2004: Visiting scientist at the Department of Pathology, University of Washington, Seattle, USA; 2007-2017: Assistant Professor of Internal Medicine, University of Padova Medical School. 2017-to date: Associate Professor of Internal Medicine, University of Padova Medical School. Scientific activity: Dr. Marcello Rattazzi started his research activity in the cardiovascular field in 2000. His research interest is primarily focused on the pathophysiological mechanisms of cardiovascular disease, mainly mechanisms of atherogenesis and vascular/valve calcification. He designed several research projects aimed at describing the phenotypic characteristics of vascular cells actively involved in calcification of atherosclerotic lesions and aortic valves (Rattazzi et al. ATVB 2005, Rattazzi et al. ATVB 2008, Bertacco et al. J Prot Res 2010, Preutsch et al. ATVB 2008, Albiero et al. Basic Res Cardiol. 2013, Rattazzi et al. ATH 2014 and 2020). Dr. Rattazzi has also been involved in the conduction of clinical studies on hypertensive/hypercholesterolemic patients with a specific focus on the mechanisms of cardiovascular organ damage and the effects of pharmacological interventions (Puato et al. Stroke 2010, Rattazzi et al. Cardiovasc Ther 2016 e 2018, Palatini et al. Hypertension 2022). More recently he also performed clinical studies investigating the link between atherosclerotic risk factors and venous thromboembolism (Rattazzi et al. JTH 2012, Rattazzi et al. Clin Sci, 2013, Rattazzi et al. Thromb Res 2015, Rattazzi et al. Thromb Res 2017, De Lucchi et al. JTH 2021, Bressan et al. Semin Thromb Hemost. 2023). Clinical activity: 2007- to date: medical care for both inpatients and outpatients in the Medicina Interna I Unit at the Ca' Foncello University Hospital of Treviso. 2017- to date: Director of the Cardiovascular Ambulatories (Hypertension and Dyslipidemia) of the Internal Medicine Department at the Ca' Foncello University Hospital of Treviso Teaching activity: 2007- to date: lecturer of Internal Medicine for students of Medicine at the University of Padova Medical School. Institutional assignments: 2012- 2020: Member of the Ethical Committee for Clinical Research of Treviso and Belluno districts; 2012 - 2021: Member of the Didactic Commission of the Residency Program in Internal Medicine of the University of Padova; 2021 to date: Coordinator of the Degree Course in Medicine and Surgery of the University of Padova 2022 to date: Director of the Residency Program in Allergology and Clinical Immunology of the University of Padova. Awards: 2001-Medical Degree award from the Italian Society of Arterial Hypertension. 2008-Young Researcher Award from the Italian Society of Cardiology. Referee activity: Referee service for: Atherosclerosis, Journal of Hypertension, PlosOne, Hypertension, Clinical Science, Heart, Molecular and Cellular Endocrinology, Journal of Molecular Cell Cardiology, Clinical Science, Cardiovascular Research, Journal of Endocrinological Investigation, Nutrition Metabolism & Cardiovascular Disease, Nutrition and Diabetes, American Journal of Cardiovascular Drugs, American Heart Journal.

name: Laura
curriculum: PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE HOSPITAL VALL D’HEBRON (Barcelona, Spain)  Clinical Coordinator of the Heart Valve Unit Jan 24 – Present  Cardiac Imaging Specialist at the Cardiology Department May 13 – Present Advanced echocardiography training in collaboration with the Radiology service. Vast experience in echocardiography, including transesophageal echocardiography and stress echocardiography. Expert in threedimensional imaging, myocardial deformation techniques and interventional cardiology monitoring. The essential value of this cardiac imaging group is eminently clinical, which has led to develop and consolidate various highly specialized subunits in collaboration with other clinical and imaging services at the centre. The Echocardiography and Cardiac Imaging Service has a long history of clinical achievements and research, as a result of its large patient population. The centre has become Spanish leader in cardiology thanks to its unrivalled commitment to outstanding patient care, research and training programmes combined with its state-of-the-art technology.  Attending Physician at the Cardiology Department May 13 – Present Senior Cardiologist in the outpatient clinic and emergency department. Recently nominated head of the hospital emergency service.  Valve heart disease specialist Feb 20 – Present Highly experienced in aortic valve disease, not only in the general population but also in clinical challenging patients. Focused in research. Awarded with a research grant in 2018 by the Spanish Cardiology Society (SEC - Sociedad Española de Cardiología) in reference to the study “Papel pronóstico de la fibrosis miocárdica difusa evaluada mediante imagen multi-modalidad en la estenosis aórtica severa de bajo flujo y bajo gradiente con fracción de eyección normal”. Development and promotion of a national registry of aortic stenosis in 2018, which has lead to several publications and the PhD completed in July 2020.  Pregnancy and heart disease specialist Oct 10 – Present Led the launch and development of a specialised cardiology unit dedicated to pregnant women with heart disease (especially for valve disease, cardiomyopathies, aortic disease and arrythmias). Elaboration and improvement of the flow chart of patients and standard operational procedures for the High-Risk Obstetric Unit. HOSPITAL QUIRONSALUD BARCELONA (Barcelona, Spain) May 13 – Present  Cardiac imaging specialist at the Cardiology department  Senior consultant at the Cardiology department  Pregnancy and heart disease specialist CAMPUS QUIRONSALUD BADALONA (Barcelona, Spain) October 23 – Present  Director of the Cardiology department HOSPITAL UNIVERSITARI DEXEUS (Barcelona, Spain) May 13 – Nov 17  Senior consultant at the Cardiology Department  Pregnancy and heart disease specialist OTHER EXPERIENCES & ACHIEVEMENTS - Member of the Board Direction of the Cardiac Imaging Section of the Spanish Society of Cardiology (16-18) - Member of the Board Direction of the Cardiac Imaging Section of the Spanish Society of Cardiology (20 – 22) - Member of the “Comisión de Formación continuada de la Sociedad Española de Cardiología” representing the Cardiac Imaging Section (16-19) - Ambassador of Spain in EACVI HIT - Heart Imagers of Tomorrow (15 – 21)

name: Gian Luigi
curriculum: ESPERIENZA LAVORATIVA • Date (da – a) Assistente Cardiologo incaricato presso la Divisione di Cardiologia dell'Ospedale Civile di Pordenone dal 01/09/1973 al 30/04/1977. Assistente Cardiologo di ruolo nella stessa Divisione dal 01/05/1977 al 23/12/1980. Aiuto incaricato di Emodinamica dal 24/12/1980 al 30/11/1981 presso l'Ospedale Civile di Pordenone. Aiuto corresponsabile ospedaliero di ruolo del Servizio di Emodinamica dell'Ospedale Civile di Pordenone dal 01/12/1981 al 01/04/1997. Primario Unità Operativa di Cardiologia Ospedale Civile di S. Vito al T.to (PN) dal 01/04/1997 al 31/01/1999. Responsabile Dipartimento Interaziendale di Cardiologia della provincia di Pordenone dal 24/10/2000. Direttore della Struttura Complessa di Cardiologia Azienda Ospedaliera “Santa Maria degli Angeli” di Pordenone dall’1.2.1999 al 10.10.2014 (Pensionamento). Direttore del Dipartimento di Cardiologia della Azienda Ospedali Riuniti di Pordenone dall’1.2.2013 al 10.10.2014 (Pensionamento). Da allora Consulente Libero Professionista Presso il Policlinico S. Giorgio di Pordenone e il Centro di Medicina di Pordenone (Centro Medico Specialistico fino a 01.10.2018). • Nome e indirizzo del datore di lavoro Azienda Ospedaliera S. Maria degli Angeli, Pordenone fino al 10.10.2014 (Pensionamento). Successivamente Consulente Libero Professionista. • Tipo di azienda o settore Policlinico S. Giorgio, Pordenone e Centro di Medicina s.p.a., Pordenone • Tipo di impiego Attualmente Libero Professionistra. Dipendente fino al 10.10.2014. • Principali mansioni e responsabilità Direttore Struttura Complessa, Direttore di Dipartimento ISTRUZIONE E FORMAZIONE • Date (da – a) Laurea in Medicina e Chirurgia presso l’Universita’ di Padova il 13/07/1972 con il massimo dei voti e la lode. Abilitato all’esercizio della professione di Medico Chirurgo nella II sessione del 1972. Specializzazione in Malattie dell’Apparato Cardiovascolare a Padova il 09/07/1975 con il massimo dei voti e la lode. Fellow dell'Associazione Nazionale dei Medici Cardiologi Ospedalieri (ANMCO), Fellow della Società Europea di Cardiologia, Fellow dell'American College of Cardiology, Research Fellow in Cardiologia presso l'Università of Kansas, Kansas City, USA dal 01/07/1977 al 30/06/1978. Conseguito il Certificato dell'Educational Commission for Foreign Medical Graduates, ECFMG, USA il 23/07/1975. Conseguita idoneità nazionale ad Aiuto di Cardiologia a Roma nel 1979 con voti 82/100. Conseguita idoneità nazionale a Primario di Cardiologia a Roma nel 1983 con voti 90/100. Membro del Comitato Scientifico dell'Italian Heart Journal dal 2000. Membro del Comitato di Redazione del Giornale Italiano di Cardiologia dal 1985 al 1993, di Cardiovascular Imaging e di Romanian Journal of Cardiology, del Giornale Italiano di Ecocardiografia Cardiovascolare fino al 1991. Fellow della International Academy of Chest Physicians and Surgeons. Membro della Società Italiana di Cardiologia Pediatrica. Membro dell'American Society of Echocardiography. Membro del Consiglio Direttivo Nazionale della Società Italiana di Ecografia Cardiovascolare dal 1991 al 1997, con elezione a Presidente Nazionale della stessa Società dal luglio 1995 a 1997, Membro eletto del Consiglio Direttivo dell'ANMCO per il biennio 1990-92. Membro del Consiglio Direttivo dell'ANMCO con l'incarico elettivo di Vice Presidente per le attività culturali per il biennio 1992-94. Membro del Consiglio Direttivo Regionale ANMCO del Friuli Venezia Giulia per il biennio 1994-96 e successivamente rieletto per il biennio 1996-98. Membro del Consiglio Direttivo Nazionale ANMCO 1998-2000. Presidente ANMCO Nazionale per il biennio 2000-2002. Past-President ANMCO Nazionale 2002-2004. Editor dell’Italian Heart Journal nel biennio 2004-2005 Founding Editor del Journal of Cardiovascular Medicine nel biennio 2006-2007 • Nome e tipo di istituto di istruzione o formazione Universita’ degli Studi di Padova • Principali materie / abilità professionali oggetto dello studio Cardiologia Clinica, Ecocardiografia, Emodinamica, Computers in Cardiology • Qualifica conseguita Specialista in Malattie Apparato Cardiovascolare

name: Felix
curriculum: Professor Felix Knauf was born in Freiburg, Germany, and studied medicine at the University Freiburg and Berlin. He completed his doctoral thesis in the Department of Physiology and Internal Medicine at Yale University followed by a subinternship at Weill Cornell Medical School New York and Hopital Lariboisière in Paris. Felix Knauf completed his internship and residency in Internal Medicine and a fellowship in Nephrology at Yale University. In 2011, he joined the Yale faculty as an attending physician in Internal Medicine and remains an Assistant Professor Adjunct. In 2017, Felix Knauf took a position at the Charité University Hospital in Berlin, Germany. He is currently the vice chair of nephrology and tenured professor on tubuloreneal disorders. In summer of 2024, Felix Knauf will be joining the Department of Nephrology and Hypertension at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota.

Currently, two of these four MDs are spending their postdoctoral-research fellowship at renowned institutions in Europe and abroad (J Münch: Universitätsspital Zuerich, Switzerland; S Sewerin: Broad Institute, Boston, USA).

name: Mirko
curriculum: Mirko Treccani achieved a BSc in Bioinformatics and a MSc in Molecular and Medical Biotechnology. Initially hesitant towards bioinformatics, he soon embraced the world of genomics, starting a PhD position in Applied Life and Health Sciences at the GM Lab (University of Verona). Currently, Mirko Treccani in a PhD Candidate in Applied Life and Health Sciences and he is shortly starting a post-doc in human genomics. During his PhD, Mirko has started working with different national and international research group, visiting and collaborating with high ranked institutions such as the Erasmus University Medical Center of Rotterdam, the University of Cambridge and the Harvard Medical School. Mirko's interests span across rare and complex diseases and human traits, investigating several life-threatening diseases with cutting edge genomic approaches, such as genome-wide association studies, genotype imputation and polygenic risk scores.

name: Andrej
curriculum: WORK RELATED ACHIEVEMENTS 2010 instituted an outpatient program of metabolic evaluation of patients with kidney stones at the Department of Nephrology in cooperation with the central laboratory 2011 cofounder of the first urinary clinical and research laboratory as part of the Department of Nephrology in Slovenia, currently the Head of the laboratory 2013 working as a Nephrology Consultant at the Department of Nephrology, University Medical Centre Ljubljana 2020 in cooperation with our hospitals Department of clinical nutrition instituted a new outpatient clinic for nutritional evaluation and support in patients with kidney diseases which I have been leading since its beginning 2022 working as an assistant professor at the Medical Faculty, University of Ljubljana WORK AND RESEARCH EXPERIENCE ABROAD 2005 three-month humanitarian work in Zambia – one month at the University Hospital in Lusaka and two months at a Mission Hospital near Kitwe 2008 one-month research exchange program at the Department of Nephrology, University Hospital Hannover (Medizinische Hochschule Hannover) in prof. Schiffer’s group 2011 two-week course in urine examination led by prof. Fogazzi at the University Hospital in Milan (Fondazione IRCCS Ca’ Granda Ospedale Maggiore Policlinico) 2012 six-month research exchange program at the Department of Nephrology, University Hospital Hannover (Medizinische Hochschule Hannover) in prof. Schiffer’s group where I did most of my doctoral thesis AWARDS AND FELLOWSHIPS 2000 Plečnik award for greatest student achievement in the fields of pathology, anatomy and histology 2004 Prešeren award for student research project: “Systemic inflammatory response syndrome in patients examined at an infectious disease emergency department” 2008 “The Bruno Watschinger poster prize” for the best poster at the Danube Symposium of Nephrology 2008 2022 Distinguished Fellow of the ERA (FERA) WORK IN SOCIETIES • Slovenian Society of Nephrology: Secretary of the Society (2013 – 2021), President of the Society (2021 – ). As the Secretary and President of the Society I have organized over 30 educational events for members of the Society and for primary care practitioners and residents of Nephrology and Internal Medicine, including international events: 6th and 7th Slovenian Congress of Nephrology, UREX 2015 (a hands-on course on urine examination organized together with prof. Fogazzi), Slovenian-Croatian meeting on peritoneal dialysis 2016, EuroPD 2019. I have been an active participant in World Kidney Day activities since 2010 and am currently the national coordinator for WKD activities. • European Renal Association: from 2016 – 2019 I was the representative from Slovenia in the ERA-EDTA Activation Committee for Central Europe that included representatives from Slovakia, Russia and Georgia. As a member of this Committee, I performed a nationwide survey in Slovenia regarding the assessment of ERA-EDTA activities and possible future goals which was presented to the Council. I also drafted a proposal for a new online service entitled ERA-EDTA Expert Opinion on Difficult Clinical Cases. The proposal was presented at the ERA-EDTA meeting of presidents of National Societies in Budapest 2019 and received the support of President Carmine Zoccali but was later not picked up. As a member of the Committee, I also participated at educational events in Slovakia and Russia. Additionally, I organized a membership arrangement between ERA and the Slovenian Society of Nephrology (SSN) by which all members of SSN are members of ERA. I provided Slovenian recipes for the ERA Cookbook. From March 2022 I have been working as a member of the ERA Renal Disaster Task Force. Sincer 2022 I am a member of the Electronic Communication Committee of the ERA. Currently I am leading a new ECC project producing a series of podcasts entitled A Pinch of Salt – A podcast by ERA. • International Society of Nephrology: from 2020 I am a member of the ISN Eastern and Central European Regional Board. As a member of this board, I organized an ISN webinar and course on kidney stones in 2023.

name: Shabbir
curriculum: Dr Moochhala is a nephrologist and physician at the Royal Free Hospital in London. He trained in Edinburgh and Newcastle upon Tyne, and has a special interest in renal physiology particularly with regard to renal stone formation. His PhD was on pyrophosphate transport physiology in the kidney. He runs the Metabolic Renal Stone clinical service at the Royal Free Hospital, and was mentored by Professor Robert Unwin. Shabbir is chief investigator for numerous interventional trials in rare stone disease. He has an interest in rare renal diseases as part of the RADAR (National Renal Rare Disease Registry) network, and is chair of the groups for hyperoxaluria and APRT deficiency. He was the nephrologist member of the NICE Guidelines Committee for renal stones, published in 2019, and is chair of OxalEurope. In 2021 he set up and now chairs the NHS Rare Disease Collaborative Network for hyperoxaluria, aiming to improve the care of patients with this rare disease.

curriculum: Médico Anestesiólogo Especialista en Medicina del Dolor y Cuidado Paliativo con amplia experiencia en atención de pacientes con dolor crónico, oncológico, agudo posoperatorio e intervencionismo en dolor crónico y oncológico. También en Anestesia Regional, Anestesia Ambulatoria y sedación para procedimientos endoscópicos fuera de salas de cirugía. Aptitudes gerenciales y de manejo de grupo enfocados en el desarrollo de proyectos y estrategias para el mejoramiento de procesos médicos y administrativos. Trabajo gremial en la Asociación Colombiana para Estudio del Dolor con participación en los congresos como Expositor e instructor en talleres, he ocupado cargos de vocal, vice presidente y actualmente nombrado como Presidente.

curriculum: Médica cirujana, especialista en anestesia y reanimación, con especialización en dolor y cuidado paliativo. name: Jan
curriculum: Jan Baumbach studied computer science at Bielefeld University in Germany. His research career started at Rothamsted Research in Harpenden (UK) where he worked on computational methods for the integration of molecular biology data. He returned to the Center for Biotechnology in Bielefeld for his PhD studies where he developed CoryneRegNet. Afterwards, at the University of California at Berkeley, he worked in the Algorithms group of Richard Karp on Transitivity Clustering, a novel clustering framework for large-scale biomedical data sets. From March 2010, Jan was head of the Computational Systems Biology group at the Max Planck Institute for Informatics in Saarbrücken, Germany. In October 2012, he moved to the University of Southern Denmark as head of the Computational BioMedicine group. His research concentrated on systems and network biomedicine. He was study program coordinator of the Computational BioMedicine program from 2015 to 2017. In January 2018 he moved to the Technical University of Munich as chair of the Experimental Bioinformatics (ExBio), where he developed computational methods for systems medicine and novel federated AI approaches ensuring privacy by design. In January 2021, the lab relocated to the University of Hamburg where Jan Baumbach became director of the Institute for Computational Systems Biology (CoSy.Bio). In 2023, he was appointed a Humboldt Scout through the Henriette Herz-Scouting-Program.

name: Feixiong
curriculum: Feixiong Cheng, Founding Director, Cleveland Clinic Genome Center, is a systems neuropharmacologist and genomicist (Neurodegenerative disease) by training, with extensive expertise in developing and applying various systems biology and genomic medicine technologies, including genomics, transcriptomics (singlecell/nuclei), proteomics, metabolomics, and interactomics (protein-protein interactions [PPIs]), and patient iPSCderived neuron and brain organoid models for translational neuro-therapeutic discovery and patient care with 15+ years’ experience. The primary goal of his lab is to create and combine tools from neurogenetics/genomics (PMIDs:33558758 [Nature Genetics 2021], 33514395 [Genome Biology 2021], and 33627474 [Genome Research 2021]), artificial intelligence (PMID:35411337 [Nature Machine Intelligence 2022]), electronic health records (EHRs, 100 million electronic patient records, PMID:32984792 [Lancet Digital Health 2020]), systems pharmacology (PMIDs:35572351 [Nature Aging 2021], 31375661, 30002366 and 30867426 [Nature Communications 2018, 2019a and 2019b]), and experimental network biology assays (PMID:36217030 [Nature Biotechnology 2023]), to address the challenging questions toward better understanding of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) and other AD-related dementia (ADRD), which could have a major impact in identifying real-world big data-driven diagnostic biomarkers and therapeutic targets for precision medicine and drug discovery in neurodegenerative diseases (PMIDs:36450252 [Cell Reports 2022], 33852912 [Cell 2021], 36331056 & 36254161 [Alzheimer's & Dementia 2022a and 2022b], and 30988527 [Nature Neuroscience 2019]). Dr. Cheng has played multiple roles in the Alzheimer's Disease Sequencing Project (ADSP) through applying machine learning and systems pharmacology approaches to identify drug targets and risk genes or networks for AD/ADRD form large-scale whole-genome/exome sequencing data and patient clinical databases. He has created multiple network systems medicine methodologies and successfully applied them for Alzheimer’s disease drug discovery: (1) in silico network medicine-based discovery combined with insurance records data mining and patient iPSC-derived neuron models identifies sildenafil (Viagra) as a candidate drug for Alzheimer’s disease (Nature Aging 2021, PMID:35572351) and a Phase II trial has been initialized; (2) multimodal singlecell/nucleus transcriptomics analysis combined with insurance records data mining identifies fluticasone and mometasone (approved asthma drugs) as candidate treatments for Alzheimer’s disease (Genome Research 2021, PMID:33627474); (3) insurance records data mining combined with mouse models identifies salsalate and diflunisal as candidate treatments for Alzheimer’s disease via reducing acetylated tau (Cell 2021, PMID:33852912); and (4) AI/ML-based multimodal analysis of genetic and genomic combined with EHR data identified pioglitazone (Alzheimer’s Research & Therapy 2022, PMID:35012639) and gemfibrozil (Cell Reports 2022, PMID:36450252) as candidate drugs for AD, and further identified Telmisartan as a potential treatment for African Americans with AD (Alzheimer and Dementia 2022, PMID: 36331056). Along with the research background described above, he has gained the necessary leadership and mentorship experience that will be essential for the success training the next generation of scientists and physicians. Through the leadership position at the Molecular Medicine PhD program (Cleveland Clinic Lerner College of Medicine of CWRU), he is co-developing strategies and mentor PhD students. Moreover, his laboratory has extensive experience with multi-PI grants (including both U01 and R01s with ~$30 millions in the past 5 years as contact PI/m-PI). He has served as a mentor on the 2021 HHMI Gilliam Graduate Mentor Award (mentor graduate students under-represented science background). Overall, Dr. Cheng has mentored or is currently mentoring two MD students, 3 PhD students, and 15 post-doctoral fellows. An emerging area of his Neurodegenerative Medicine Discovery Laboratory is focused on developing cutting edge experimental systems biology (iPSC and brain organoids) and multi-omics technologies to identify novel drug targets and candidate treatments for Alzheimer’s disease and other neurodegenerative diseases.

name: Yang-Yu
curriculum: Dr. Yang-Yu Liu serves as an Associate Professor of Medicine at Harvard Medical School and an Associate Scientist at Brigham and Women’s Hospital. He earned his Ph.D. in Physics from University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in 2009, and then received his postdoctoral training at Northeastern University. His groundbreaking work on network controllability was published as a cover story in Nature, a cover story in PNAS, and an article in Reviews of Modern Physics, among others, garnering widespread media attention. In 2013, Dr. Liu established his own lab, where he has since dedicated his efforts to human microbiome research. His contributions to this field have been published as original research articles in Nature, Nature Methods, Nature Machine Intelligence, Nature Ecology & Evolution, Nature Mental Health, etc., and an invited review article in Cell Systems, and have received a variety of media coverage such as NBC News, The Economist, and WIRED, among others. For more information, please visit: https://yangyuliu.bwh.harvard.edu.

name: Sabrina
curriculum: Sabrina Maniscalco is the Professor of Quantum Information and Logic at the University of Helsinki, and an Adjunct Professor at Aalto University, Finland. She is the Vice Director of the Finnish Centre of Excellence for Quantum Technologies and serves in the scientific advisory board of several international institutions, such as the Institute for Quantum Optics and Quantum Information (Austria) and the Quantum Technology initiative at CERN. She is CEO and co-founder of Algorithmiq Ltd, a startup focusing on quantum algorithms and software. Sabrina obtained her PhD at the University of Palermo (Italy) in 2004. She has held academic research positions around the world, in Sofia (Bulgaria), Durban (South Africa), Turku (Finland) and Edinburgh (UK). She returned to Finland in 2014 to lead the Theoretical Physics Laboratory in Turku. She then moved to the University of Helsinki in November 2020. Sabrina represented Finland’s Quantum National strategy at the White House in May 2022 and is a national figure in quantum for Finland. Sabrina has coordinated several international and interdisciplinary projects and is recognised as one of the leading experts in Quantum Technologies

name: Jörg
curriculum: Jörg Menche studied physics in Germany and Brazil and obtained a PhD at the Max Planck Institute for Colloids and Interfaces in 2010. He worked as a postdoc at Northeastern University and Harvard Medical School in Boston, before starting his own research group at the CeMM Research Center for Molecular Medicine in Vienna in 2015. In 2020 he became full professor at the University of Vienna where he holds a shared appointment at the Center for Molecular Biology (Max Perutz Labs) and the Faculty of Mathematics. In 2024 he became the founding director of the Ludwig Boltzmann Institute for Network Medicine at the University of Vienna. His interdisciplinary team combines backgrounds ranging from biology and bioinformatics to medicine, physics, mathematics & arts. The broad ambition of his group is to use tools and concepts from network theory to elucidate the complex machinery of interacting molecules that constitutes the basis of (patho-)physiological states. Major areas of interest are network-based approaches to rare diseases, understanding the basic principles of how perturbations of biological systems influence each other and developing novel Virtual Reality (VR) based technologies for analyzing large genomic data.

name: Paolo
curriculum: “Paolo Parini was born in Rimini, Italy, in 1964. He gained his MD degree in 1990 at the Universita’ di Bologna, Italy, where he also obtained his specialization in Gastroenterology and Hepatology, in 1994. The same year Parini was registered as PhD-student at the Karolinska Institutet, Sweden, under the supervision of Prof Mats Rudling and Prof Bo Angelin. In 1999, he obtained his PhD defending a thesis entitled “Hormonal regulation of hepatic cholesterol and lipoprotein metabolism: effects of estrogen and growth hormone” and since then his research activities are focused on the different aspects of lipoprotein metabolism in humans and in preclinical models. Professor Parini’s postdoctoral activities have been performed at the Dept of Medicine, Karolinska Institutet, and in the lab of Prof Lawrence Rudel, Lipid Sciences, Wake Forest University School of Medicine Winston-Salem, NC, US. In 2006, he moved to the Dept of Laboratory Medicine, Karolinska Institutet, and created a research group together with Prof Mats Eriksson. From 2010 to 2016, Paolo Parini was the Director of the Division of Clinical Chemistry, Dept. of Laboratory Medicine, Karolinska Institutet. In 2011, he obtained the specialization in Clinical Chemistry (Swedish National Board of Health and Welfare) and in 2012 he become full professor in Clinical Chemistry at the Dept of Laboratory Medicine, Karolinska Institutet. Since 2015, his professorship became “translational” being located 50% at the Dept of Laboratory Medicine and 50% at the Dept of Medicine, Karolinska Institutet. Since January 2017, Professor Parini is also the Director of Research, Development, Education, and Innovation currently at the National and International Affairs of the Karolinska University Hospital, Sweden. He is member of the Faculty Council the Karolinska Institutet and member of the Scientific Committee of the Center E. Grossi Paoletti, Universita’ di Milano, Italy. Professor Parini has been visiting professor in 2022 and 2023 at he Division of Cardiovascular Medicine, Dept of Medicine, at Brigham and Women’s Hospital and at Harvard Medical School, Boston, USA, and visiting professor at the Department of Pharmacological and Biomolecular Sciences, University of Milano (2017 – 2019). Professor Parini served on the Society’s Executive Committee as Treasurer between 2018 and 2021. He has represented Sweden in the Steering Committee of the European Lipoprotein Club (2005-2010) and in the Steering Committee of the Scandinavian Society of Atherosclerosis Reseach (2008 – 2021). He has been the Chairman of the Scandinavian Society of Atherosclerosis Research between 2011 and 2015”

name: Harald
curriculum: With a double degree in Medicine and Pharmacy, Harald Schmidt works in network and systems medicine to re-define what we call "disease" from a descriptive symptom- and organ-based to a mechanism-based approach by using big data, multi-target validation, new mechanism-based diagnostics, and rapid repurposing of registered drugs for new clinical applications by network pharmacology. He applies this to areas of unmet medical need, such as the development and commercialization of a first-in-class neuroprotective therapy in stroke, a therapy against a common and untreatable form of heart failure, and a therapy for resistant hypertension. He coordinates the H2020 project REPO-TRIAL on in-silico network pharmacology and the organ-agnostic European drug repurposing platform project REPO4EU. He was awarded an ERC AdG, and an ERC PoC grant, and chaired two COST actions. He co-founded the journals ‚Drug Repurposing‘ and ‚Network Medicine‘ and is on the Harvard-led Network Medicine Alliance board. His multi-national research experience in Academia (Germany, USA, Australia, Netherlands), Industry (Abbott Labs), and Biotech (Vasopharm) have led to high-impact publications (Hirsch index 102) with high socio-economic relevance such as drug and diagnostics patents, spin-offs and patient benefit. He has trained several successful scientists and clinical leaders and is a research- and evidence-based teacher, speaker, podcaster, and author (The End of Medicine As We Know It, Geheilt statt behandelt).

name: Marinka
curriculum: Marinka Zitnik (https://zitniklab.hms.harvard.edu) is an Assistant Professor of Biomedical Informatics at Harvard Medical School, at Kempner Institute for the Study of Natural and Artificial Intelligence at Harvard University, and at Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard. Zitnik investigates foundations of AI that contribute to the scientific understanding of medicine and therapeutic design, eventually enabling AI to learn and innovate on its own. Her research won best paper and research awards, including the Kavli Fellowship of the National Academy of Sciences, Kaneb Fellowship award at Harvard Medical School, NSF CAREER Award, awards from the International Society for Computational Biology, International Conference in Machine Learning, Bayer Early Excellence in Science, Amazon Faculty Research, Google Faculty Research, Roche Alliance with Distinguished Scientists, and Sanofi iDEA-iTECH Award. Zitnik founded Therapeutics Data Commons, a global open-science initiative to access and evaluate AI across stages of development and therapeutic modalities, and she served as the faculty lead of the AI4Science initiative.

name: Andrea
curriculum: The research activity is aimed at the study of molecular aspects in cardio-immuno-metabolic diseases, with the aim of proposing potential pharmacological targets. Three themes, developed in detail, make up this general idea: • Understanding the role of the innate immune response in the development of metabolic alterations induced by dyslipidemia. Objectives: To study the activity of the innate immune component in response to metabolic alterations induced by dietary fats. To understand the molecular mechanisms by which the innate immune response reprograms its immune competencies to address, in the long term, the chronic effects of metabolic alterations. • Study of the gut-liver-marrow axis in dyslipidemias Objective: To identify the molecular mechanisms that explain the inflammatory consequences of the metabolic response to lipid ("post-prandial") nutritional stimuli. To translate these aspects to humans, identifying new potential markers/targets for hypertriglyceridemia and mixed atherogenic dyslipidemia. • Identification of new markers for the personalization of cardiovascular risk stratification Objective: To identify clusters of molecular, genomic, epigenomic, metagenomic and vascular markers of clinical interest to optimize the risk stratification of atherosclerotic and metabolic diseases. This activity is possible thanks to the development of expertise in developing artificial intelligence basedprediction models and the collaboration with clinical centers, epidemiological studies that allow the achievement of biobanks, genetic/clinical/translational data, imaging and in vivo experimental protocols.

name: Rosaria
curriculum: Awards • Pandolfi prize 2019 from SIPmeT • Tony B. scientific prize in January 2013, Orlando, USA • Subject Expert in General Pathology, years 2018-2021 Research record at a glance (quick facts): 53 articles h-index: 20 12 articles as first-author, 8 articles as corresponding author

name: David B.
curriculum: Prof. Dr. David B. Blumenthal heads the Biomedical Network Science Lab at FAU Erlangen-Nürberg. Together with his team, he investigates molecular disease mechanisms, using techniques from network science, combinatorial optimization, and artificial intelligence. He also develops privacy-preserving decentralized biomedical AI solutions and is interested in meta-scientific questions such as reproducibility and the impact of data bias on biomedical AI systems. Before joining FAU, David studied mathematics and philosophy at FU and TU Berlin, did a PhD in computer science at the Free University of Bozen-Bolzano, and worked as a postdoctoral researcher at the Chair of Experimental Bioinformatics at the Technical University of Munich.

name: Manuela
curriculum: Main activities: - Epidemiological studies on cardiovascular disease and associated risk factors - collaboration with the SISA Center for the Study of Atherosclerosis, Bassini Hospital (Cinisello Balsamo, MI) and the Laboratory of Lipoproteins and Atherosclerosis, IRCCS MultiMedica (Sesto San Giovanni, MI) for the collection and analysis of clinical data - collaboration with Prof. Brian Ference (University of Cambridge) to conduct Mendelian randomisation studies - collaboration with Fondazione Bruno Kessler for the design of algorithms for the evaluation of cardiovascular risk using Artificial Intelligence tools and frameworks - Pharmacoutilization and pharmacoepidemiology studies: analyses of administrative, clinical, of pharmacovigilance databases with record linkage procedures, or meta-analyses from published data - collaboration with the Department of Statistics and Quantitative Methods (DISMEQ) of University of Milan-Bicocca - collaboration with the Clinical Pharmacology Unit of the L. Sacco Hospital - Evaluation of appropriate medication use (drug-drug interactions, off-label use, misprescribing/ overprescribing, adherence to therapy) and educative/informative interventions - collaboration with the Department of Translational Medicine, Amedeo Avogadro University of Eastern Piedmont (UNIPMN) - collaboration with the Center of Pharmacoeconomics and Drug Utilization Research (CIRFF) of the University of Naples Federico II - collaboration with the Department of Medical and Surgical Sciences-Pharmacology Unit, University of Bologna - collaboration with the Department of Drug Design and Pharmacology, University of Copenhagen - Coordination of activities for clinical/epidemiological studies carried out by SISA Foundation for the promotion of research on atherosclerotic diseases, including interactions with the ethics committees for the procedural aspects and relations with the participating researchers Literature search and review for monthly newsletters, SEFAP website updating on drug utilization, pharmacovigilance, pharmacoepidemiology, health economy Co-tutor/Tutor for PhD students Mentoring activity for theoretical and experimental theses Editorial Board of SEFAPnews (SEFAP monthly newsletters) Associate Editor for GIA (Giornale Italiano dell’Aterosclerosi), NMCD (Nutrition, Metabolism and Cardiovascular Diseases), Annals of Medicine

name: Laure
curriculum: I started my researches in the field of pharmacogenetics of immunosuppressive treatments 15 years ago, during my master degree (2005-2006). My master project has made my passion for drug PK instinctive. I was interested in understanding the factors that make tacrolimus to accumulate considerably in the hepatic tissue of some patients whereas it was cleared rapidly in others; therefore, affecting the individual therapeutic response to the drug. These achievements made me wanted to extend my knowledge to other drugs and other body compartments. Mainly, when I started my PhD, exploring anti-HIV drugs and their accumulation in PBMCs was my next target. Along the years, I saw the PK world around me evolving from a descriptive and explanatory tool towards a predictive modelling patientcentred method and I got the feeling that I had also to progress. After my postdoctoral stay in Rotterdam (2010-2012), my subsequent personal defy was thus to build a new research group to reach my ambitions. Since 2013, my team, the integrated Pharmacometrics, Pharmacogenetics, Pharmacokinetcs [PMGK] research group, is working on different projects combining clinical, experimental, cellular and molecular approaches to understand the diversity of pharmacological responses. In this framework, my ambition is now to initiate a new horizon in pharmacotherapy integrating host factors in complex models to predict drug metabolism and response to therapy. My current desire is to develop an original novel approach that will combine multiple ground-breaking methods into an integrated pioneering concept aiming at predicting and understanding the PK behavior of drugs and its link with the pharmacological response for a better management of pharmacotherapy. I have faith that this multidimensional framework will generate a real operational network for biological understanding and predictability of drug behavior.

name: Julia
curriculum: After studying molecular bionics and molecular medicine in Hungary, Sweden, and England, Julia pursued her PhD at the LBI of Rare and Undiagnosed Diseases and the CeMM Research Center for Molecular Medicine. She has coordinated cross-disciplinary efforts to develop standardized ontologies for rare diseases of the immune system and has analyzed and integrated complex biological datasets while developing a network medicine framework for autoimmune and autoinflammatory diseases. Julia is currently a postdoctoral fellow at the Max Perutz Labs, University of Vienna in Austria pursuing further projects combining computational approaches and rare diseases.

name: Ruth
curriculum: “Ruth Johnson is a Berkowitz Family Living Laboratory Postdoctoral Research Fellow. Her research focuses on developing computational and statistical methods for understanding the genetic basis of disease, particularly through electronic health records and genomic biobank studies. Ruth received her PhD from the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) in computer science and bachelor's degree also from UCLA in mathematics. During her PhD, she was actively involved in research with the UCLA ATLAS Precision Health Biobank and focused on studying genetic disease risk in ancestrally diverse populations"

name: Helen
curriculum: Helen Kang is a PhD student in the Computational and Systems Biology program at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). She aspires to use computational and experimental methods to uncover key cellular processes that drive cardiovascular disease. Prior to joining MIT, Helen studied the genetic underpinnings of coronary artery disease (CAD) in Dr. Jesse Engreitz’s laboratory at Stanford. She created an approach, Variant-to-Gene-to-Program (V2G2P), to systematically study CAD and to dissect new disease mechanisms. Helen obtained Bachelor of Arts in applied mathematics and molecular and cellular biology from University of California, Berkeley. Outside of research, Helen enjoys traveling across the globe, hiking in the nature, exploring museums, and listening to classical music.

name: Camila
curriculum: My research involves developing and applying genomics and systems biology methods to understand the gene regulatory processes in males and females that contribute to disease development and therapeutic response, with a focus on lung diseases. I have a strong background in molecular biology, genomics, computational and systems biology. During my PhD, I was trained in both experimental biology and bioinformatics to understand the molecular mechanisms associated with treatment response in rectal cancer, and to find molecular biomarkers predictive of treatment efficacy. During my postdoctoral fellowship, I substantially improved my knowledge of computational and systems biology, and network medicine. I worked with omic data, and the application of network methods to a wide range of problems, including the study of regulatory differences between cell lines and their tissues of origin, tissue-specific gene regulation, the association of PD1 pathway regulation with survival in glioblastoma, and the study of sex differences in healthy tissues and in colon cancer. My collection of network models (which include healthy and disease tissues) are publicly available and are a valuable resource for future research on network disruptions that lead to diseases. I have been funded by the American Lung Association to explore sex differences in lung cancer survival outcomes and uncover therapeutic targets via sex-specific gene regulatory networks. My ongoing K01 grant focus on studying the molecular mechanisms driving sex differences in COPD onset and heterogeneity using integrative multi-omic data analysis and network-based approaches. My academic training and research experience in multiple disciplines, including molecular, computational and systems biology, make me well suited to mentor and contribute to research projects using multi-omics and network approaches to better understand sex-based differences in lung diseases and identify more tailored and effective treatment strategies.

name: Elena
curriculum: Department of Pharmacological and Biomolecular Sciences, University of Milan, Milan, Italy

name: Matteo
curriculum: Scientist with more than 15 years of competence and experience in the field of cardiometabolic diseases, lipid and lipoprotein metabolism have been the major interest of my research since my PhD studies. I am combining excellent skills in laboratory techniques together with a great experience as public speaker, meeting organizer and project coordinator. Enthusiastic, forward-thinking and well-organized team player with an extreme attitude to adapt and improve new environment. I achieved the MSc in Drug Chemistry and Technologies in 2005 at the University of Parma, Italy, where I performed my doctoral study (2006-2008) to obtain a PhD in Experimental pharmacology and toxicology in 2009. 2008-2009 I was visiting scientist at Karolinska Institutet (Sweden), where I completed my first postdoc fellowship (2010-2014). 2014-2017 I joined AstraZeneca Med-Immune postdoc programme with a project aimed to investigate the HDL subclasses present in metabolic diseases and their capacities for mobilizing extracellular lipids. Since 2017 I have been employed as Research Coordinator at Karolinska Institutet, joining the Cardiometabolic Unit, Dept of Medicine and of Laboratory Medicine, which drives innovative and implementable research and education, closely integrated with specialized health care. I have more than 30 publications in scientific peer-reviewed journal and my research focused on a intracellular cholesterol esterifying enzyme (SOAT2) led to a patent on SOAT2-specific inhibitor PRD-family compounds, which I co-share with Kitasato University. I am steering committee member of the Lipid and Lipoprotein network at Karolinska Institutet, council member of the Scandinavian Society for Atherosclerosis Research, and co-founder and owner of Lipoprotein Research Stockholm AB. I have been lecturer for several doctoral courses and supervisor for several students. Since 2022, I'm acting as Chief Safety representative at Karolinska Institutet.

name: Jonathan
curriculum: Armed with a deep understanding of Biomedicine and Data Science, I am determined to make a significant impact in the field of medical research.

name: Clemens
curriculum: Medial data scientist with a life science background and a specialization in the application and validation of predictive modeling solutions in cancer research, oncology, and cardiac amyloidosis. Know-how in the application of explainable artificial intelligence, vision-based deep learning, and analysis of high-dimensional biomedical data. Experienced in solving complex problems together with clinical, biological and computer science experts.

name: Rosa
curriculum: Rosa Suades (RS) is a junior researcher of Centro de Investigación Biomédica en Red Enfermedades Cardiovasculares (CIBERCV) from Institute of Health Carlos III at the Research Institute of the Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau (IR SANT PAU). She previously obtained her PhD entitled “Role of microparticles in atherothrombosis” at the Universitat Pompeu Fabra (UPF) under the supervision of Prof. Lina Badimon (2014), by which she was granted by the Doctoral School PhD Extraordinary Award from UPF and the “Enrique Fuentes Quintana” Health Science PhD Award from the Spanish Foundation of Savings Banks FUNCAS for excellence and rigor in her doctoral research (2016). She did a postdoctoral stage at the Molecular Cardiology Group within Cardiology Unit, Department of Medicine, Karolinska Institute (Stockholm, Sweden) under the supervision of Prof. Francesco Cosentino (2017-2021). During her postdoctoral stage, she was a member of the Steering Committee at the KI Junior Faculty. RS has received predoctoral fellowships from CIBER OBN (obesidad y Nutrición) and from Instituto Carlos III (PFIS-FI09/00092, ISCIII) and postdoctoral fellowships from European Society of Cardiology (ESC Research Grant) and Daniel Bravo Andreu Foundation. In 2021, she was the recipient of a returning Beatriu de Pinós fellowship [2019BP00211] from University and Research Grants Management Agency (Government of Catalonia) co-funded by COFUNDMarie Skłodowska-Curie Actions in the Horizon 2020 programme (European Commission). RS has published 39 articles (h-index = 20) including original manuscripts and reviews with >1500 total citations. RS has been co-investigator of International and National research projects funded by the government. RS has been awarded with the Young Investigator Award of European Mediterranean League Against Thromboembolic Diseases (EMLTD) (Valencia 2014 and Istambul 2016), Young Investigator Award of International Society of Thrombosis and Haemostasis (ISTH) (Amsterdam 2013) and travel grants from ESC (London 2015 and Munich 2018). RS is ad-hoc reviewer of peer-reviewed international journals and she has co-directed several undergraduate and graduate students. She is member of professional societies (ESC, ESC Scientists of Tomorrow, EMLTD, and Spanish Society of Cardiology). Her main research interests involve extracellular vesicles, non-coding RNAs and microRNAs, epigenetics, platelets, cardiovascular risk factors, diabetes, subclinical atherosclerosis and thrombosis, ischaemic heart disease, among others.
